DECLARED:

In consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the parties hereto acknowledge and agree as follows:

Instead of performing a specific action in the original clause, we have made it an option for one party to act:

(Original) Party A shall have the right but not the obligation to perform Action X within 30 days after written notice.

(Revised) Party A may, at its discretion, choose to perform Action X within 30 days following a written notice.

The revised clause weakens the original obligation by making it optional for Party A, whereas in the original, Party A was required to act unless explicitly excused under certain circumstances.

original: (d)  "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time commencing January 1, 1996, and concluding December 31, 1998, unless sooner terminated in accordance with the terms and conditions hereof.
ollama_generated: (d) "Contract Term" denotes the duration commencing from January 1, 1996, up until December 31, 1998, unless it is mutually agreed by both parties to extend beyond this period or one party terminates the contract in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.

original: In addition, TPC agrees to pay all reasonable and necessary expenses (including first class travel, hotel accommodations and meal expenses) incurred by Consolidated Artists in connection with such photograph shoots and personal appearances.
modified: Furthermore, Consolidated Artists shall be reimbursed for any ordinary and essential costs (excluding first-class travel, but including accommodation and meal expenses) associated with the aforementioned photograph sessions and public appearances, as incurred by TPC, under the condition that such costs are deemed reasonable and necessary.

original: 9.    TOURNAMENT BONUSES. In addition to the Retainer Fee set forth in Paragraph 8 above, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle the following tournament bonuses for Ogle's tournament performances during the Contract Period (the "Tournament Bonus or Bonuses"):
modified: 9. TOURNAMENT BONUSES MODIFICATION: Instead of the Retainer Fee specified in Paragraph 8 above, Consolidated Artists shall be solely responsible for negotiating and receiving any tournament bonuses on behalf of Ogle for his tournament performances during the Contract Period (hereinafter referred to as "Potential Tournament Bonus"). TPC's obligation to provide such bonuses is contingent upon their receipt by Consolidated Artists, and TPC shall have no liability if Consolidated Artists are unable to secure these bonuses.

original: 11. ROYALTY COMPENSATION FOR ENDORSED PRODUCT. In addition to the Retainer Fee, Tournament Bonuses and Money List Bonuses set forth in Paragraphs 8, 9 and 10 above, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle royalty compensation of ten percent (10%) of the net sales of all Endorsed Products distributed or sold during the Contract Period in or to the Countries of Australia and New Zealand ("Royalty Compensation"). "Net sales" shall mean the gross invoice price billed to customers, less customary trade/quantity discounts, rebates and returns actually credited, but with no deductions of any kind. No costs incurred by TPC in the manufacture, advertisement, promotion or exploitation of any Endorsed Product shall be deducted as a cost in calculating the net sales. TPC agrees to guarantee to Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a minimum Royalty Compensation of Twenty Thousand U.S. Dollars ($20,000) payable in four (4) equal installments of Five Thousand U.S. Dollars ($5,000) and due simultaneously with the Retainer Fee on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
modified: 11. MODIFIED ROYALTY COMPENSATION FOR ENDORSED PRODUCTS. In addition to the Retainer Fee, Tournament Bonuses, and Money List Bonuses as outlined in Paragraphs 8, 9, and 10 respectively, TPC is obligated to remit to Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a modified royalty compensation for Endorsed Products. This royalty compensation will be calculated as five percent (5%) of the net sales of all Endorsed Products distributed or sold during the Contract Period in or to the Countries of Australia and New Zealand ("Modified Royalty Compensation"). The definition of "net sales" remains unchanged, but it is clarified that any costs incurred by TPC in the manufacture, advertisement, promotion, or exploitation of any Endorsed Product shall be deducted as a cost in calculating the net sales. No minimum Modified Royalty Compensation will be guaranteed to Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle. Instead, the actual payment will be made only if and when TPC achieves net sales that justify the five percent (5%) royalty compensation. Payments shall be made quarterly, with the first installment due simultaneously with the Retainer Fee on or before the first (1st) day of February in each Contract Year.

original: 16. TIME OF THE ESSENCE. TPC acknowledges that time is of the essence in the payment of all compensation due Consolidated Artists hereunder. For the purposes of this Agreement, all payments not received within thirty (30) days of the date due shall be deemed "past due". Such past due payments shall bear interest at a rate of two percent (2%) per month OR the maximum rate permissible by law, whichever is less. The imposition of interest provided for in this Paragraph shall be in addition to any other remedies available to Consolidated Artists under this Agreement or otherwise. Accordingly, Consolidated Artists shall not be precluded from exercising any other remedies, whether at law or in equity, to enforce the terms of this Agreement.
modified: 16. GRACE PERIOD FOR PAYMENTS. While TPC acknowledges that prompt payment is important for Consolidated Artists hereunder, it is understood that a grace period of up to thirty (30) days may be granted for the payment of all compensation due. For the purposes of this Agreement, any payments not received within this grace period shall not automatically be considered "past due". However, such late payments will accrue interest at a rate of two percent (2%) per month OR the maximum rate permissible by law, whichever is less. The accrual of interest provided for in this Paragraph does not preclude TPC from seeking other remedies available to it under this Agreement or otherwise. Accordingly, TPC reserves the right to pursue any legal or equitable remedies to enforce the terms of this Agreement without limitation.

original: 17. SPECIAL RIGHT OF NEGOTIATION AND TERMINATION. If at any time during the Contract Period Ogle determines that he no longer desires to use the Endorsed Product Consolidated Artists shall so notify TPC in writing and the parties shall meet and negotiate in good faith an amicable solution. Such discussion shall take place within fourteen (14) days of Consolidated Artists' notice and shall include such issues as Ogle's continued use of the Endorsed Product, the continued use of the Ogle Endorsement and the termination of this Agreement. If no solution is reached within fourteen (14) days of such negotiation, the parties agree that this Agreement shall automatically terminate and that TPC will cease - 12 - using the Ogle Endorsement, the name "Brett Ogle," or any facsimile thereof, for any promotional or advertising purposes in accordance with the terms set forth in Paragraph 5 above. In addition, TPC agrees that Consolidated Artists shall be entitled to the Retainer Fee prorated to the effective date of termination as well any Tournament Bonuses, Money List Bonuses and any Royalty Compensation earned by Consolidated Artists prior to the effective date of termination.
ollama_generated: 17. SPECIAL RIGHT OF WITHDRAWAL AND TERMINATION. If at any point during the Contract Term, Consolidated Artists elects to discontinue use of the Endorsed Product, TPC must be notified in writing and the parties will convene within fourteen (14) days for a good faith discussion. The discussions shall encompass potential resolutions regarding Consolidated Artists' cessation of Endorsed Product usage, the withdrawal of the TPC Endorsement, and any applicable provisions for early termination of this Agreement. In the event that no agreement is reached within fourteen (14) days, both parties acknowledge and accept that the Agreement will be dissolved, and TPC will promptly discontinue the use of the TPC Endorsement, "Brett Ogle," or any likeness thereof, in accordance with Paragraph 5 for promotional or advertising purposes. Moreover, Consolidated Artists shall retain the right to the Retainer Fee adjusted proportionally to the termination date, as well as any Tournament Bonuses, Money List Bonuses, and Royalty Compensation earned before the effective termination date.

original: TPC agrees that such termination shall not relieve it of its obligation to pay Consolidated Artists all compensation contemplated hereunder. Accordingly, Consolidated Artists shall not waive any of its rights at law or in equity.
ollama_generated: In the event of TPC's termination, it acknowledges that this act does not absolve it from its financial obligations towards Consolidated Artists, as outlined within this agreement. Consequently, Consolidated Artists retains the right to pursue any legal or equitable remedies available to them.

original: 22. SPECIAL RIGHT OF TERMINATION BY TPC. TPC shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to Consolidated Artists or Advantage in the event of the occurrence of any of the following contingencies:
modified:
22. DISCRETIONARY TERMINATION BY TPC. Upon its sole discretion, TPC may terminate this Agreement with a thirty (30)-day written notice to either Consolidated Artists or Advantage, effective immediately in the event that any of the following circumstances arise:

This modification shifts some of the power to terminate the agreement to TPC's discretion instead of specific contingencies. It allows them to end the contract based on their judgment without being bound by a particular set of conditions.

original: - 17 - IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be executed as of the date first above written.
ollama_generated:
17 - This Agreement is executed by the parties herein on the date first written above, as a testament of their mutual consent and understanding.

In this revised version, the focus shifts from the act of the parties causing the agreement to be executed towards the execution itself being a testament of their mutual consent and understanding. The original clause emphasizes the action taken by the parties (causing the Agreement to be executed), while the revised clause emphasizes the result of that action (the execution itself).
